page.title: 03HILLSIDE OLD PEOPLE'S HOME
page.content: The home was built in 1962 and consists of twenty double bedrooms, eleven single rooms, two four-bedded rooms and a sickroom. The officer-in- charge is Mr. Hollins who has two full-time and one part-time assistants together with 25 part-time care assistants and 13 domestics. The residents have the use of 5 day rooms which are equipped with T.V., books, papers, record-player and jigsaw puzzles. There are individual spotlights on the chairs for reading. Along the corridors are handrails to assist those who find walking difficult. Other walking aids are also provided. Residents are usually supervised wheh bathing. There is a Medic bath which allows an old person to walk into the bath and then sit down. for reading. Craft classes are held on Monday afternoons.
